entry.title: Nigeria Might Support Bitcoin And Cryptocurrencies, New Report Shows
entry.summary:
The cryptocurrency market and bitcoin popularity in Nigeria have been rising in recent years. Despite the ban on crypto trades by the government in 2021, Nigerians continued to engage in cryptocurrency-related activities. Most citizens became more interested in crypto to gain financial freedom.
A report released by The Punch News after interviewing the House of Representatives Committee on Capital Markets chairman Babangida Ibrahim said that the Nigerian Securities and Exchange Commission will recognize cryptocurrencies as a capital investment if an amendment to the Investment and Securities Act 2007 Bill is passed into law.
Nigerian Capital Market Must Align With Global Practices, Ibrahim Babangida
Ibrahim Babangida said there is a need for Nigeria to keep pace with the trends andâ€¦

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Expected To Give Nod To U.S. Extradition
entry.summary:
Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder and former CEO of crypto exchange FTX, will legally forgo his extradition to the United States, Reuters reported on Monday, citing sources with knowledge of the situation. This comes only days after he was remanded to a Bahamian jail for a hearing.
Bankman-Fried has been detained in the Bahamas since his arrest on Monday, when he was denied bail in connection with multiple U.S. criminal allegations.
Before his detention, in multiple interviews following FTXâ€™s downfall last month, Bankman-Fried denied orchestrating a multi-year fraud scheme and abusing the law.
Extradition will pave the way for a protracted legal showdown in the U.S. On Tuesday, the Southern District of New York of the Justice Department unsealed a 13-page criminal indictment.
FTXâ€¦

entry.title: Web3 Privacy Layer Aztec Raises $100 Million in Series B Funding Round to Produce an Encrypted Version of Ethereum
entry.summary: Aztec, a Web3 privacy layer, has raised $100 million in a Series B funding round led by the Andreessen Horowitz subsidiary a16z crypto. The organization, which already offers privacy-based services for a slew of Ethereum-based apps, will now focus on constructing an encrypted version of Ethereum, allowing individuals and organizations to transact privately. Aztec Raises $100 Million to Create Interoperable and Encrypted Blockchains Web3 privacy-focused layer Aztec raised $100 million on Dec. 15 as part of its Series B funding round. The resources raised during this round, which was led by a16z crypto with the participation of A Capital, King River, Variant, SV Angel, Hash Key, Fenbushi, and AVG, will be used on building a high-level encrypted version of Ethereum. For Aztec, while todayâ€™s fâ€¦

entry.summary:
Multi-billionaire Elon Musk is currently letting users vote on his chief executive position at Twitter, while the Dogecoin community puzzles over what this could mean for DOGE.
â€œShould I step down as head of Twitter?â€ he wrote Sunday. â€œI will abide by the results of this poll.â€ Users can vote yes or no.
More than 14.3 million people have already participated in the poll as of press time. It will run until 6:00 am ET, with 57% voting so far in favor of Musk stepping down as Twitter CEO.
The Crypto Community Reacts To Elon Muskâ€™s Vote
The vote is generating a buzz within the crypto community as well. Vitalik Buterin, mastermind behind Ethereum, paid his respects to Musk, writing, â€œok I actually respect this.â€
ok I actually respect this

entry.title: Government Agencies Need Crypto Wallets and Access to Exchanges, Russian Prosecutors Say
entry.summary:
Russian authorities are finding it hard to cash out digital assets they have gotten hold of, prosecutors have warned. They have also urged the government to recognize cryptocurrency as property, allow departments to have digital wallets and use crypto exchanges.
Prosecutorâ€™s Office Insists Russian Investigators Should Have Cryptocurrency Wallets
Russian prosecutors are convinced that investigative authorities, among other government bodies, should be allowed to set up crypto wallets and be able to store and convert confiscated digital coins to fiat money, the business daily Kommersant reported.
The Prosecutor Generalâ€™s Office has consistently advocated for recognizing digital assets as property that can be seized, if acquired criminally, Prosecutor Madina Dolgieva from the Officeâ€™s â€¦

entry.title: Social Engineering Strikes Again As $1M+ Bored Ape Collection Stolen
entry.summary:
Bored Ape Yacht Club NFTs have become a staple in crypto culture. As one of the most recognizable collections in the NFT landscape, that too has come with a major target for scammers, hackers, and other unsavory players.
As the NFT space grows, so too does the sophisticated nature of exploits and hacks. Over the weekend, this was on prime display, as a sophisticated scheme resulted in a major Bored Ape collection heist.
Bored Ape Blues Hacking and exploits targeting Bored Ape owners are nothing new. Case studies surrounding the collection span for well over the past year: from Hollywood actor Seth Green, to entire Discord exploits, weâ€™ve seen a whole garden variety of successful BAYC exploit attempts.
While itâ€™s no fault of Yuga Labs, these exploits continue to shine light on how viâ€¦

entry.title: SEC Chairman Says Important to Regulate Crypto Issuers and Intermediaries
entry.summary:
The chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), Gary Gensler, has stressed the importance of bringing â€œintermediaries and issuers of crypto securitiesâ€ into compliance. In addition, the U.S. Treasury Departmentâ€™s Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC) has recommended that regulatory agencies continue to â€œenforce existing rules and regulations applicable to the crypto-asset ecosystem.â€
SEC Chair Gensler on Crypto Regulation
SEC Chairman Gary Gensler talked about crypto regulation Friday in his remarks before the U.S. Treasury Departmentâ€™s Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC). Gensler said:
Nothing about the crypto markets is incompatible with the securities laws. Yet risks from this speculative, volatile, and what I believe is a largely noncompliant mâ€¦

According to multiple reports, FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Friedâ€™s parents face scrutiny over their reported involvement with their sonâ€™s business operations. The two Stanford professors Joseph Bankman and Barbara Fried have not been charged with any wrongdoing, but the current FTX CEO, John J. Ray III, recently told members of the U.S. Congress that Joseph Bankman and â€œthe family certainly received paymentsâ€ from FTX.
SBFâ€™s Ethics-Obsessed Parents Face Scrutiny Over Their Alleged Ties With FTX Operations
On Saturday, a report from Reuters detailed that the FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) will likely surrender to a U.S. extradition request, after it was initially reported that SBF would fight extradition to the United States. Reports detail that SBFâ€™s parents, who are reportedly â€¦

entry.title: Nigeria Looking To Legalize Bitcoin Usage: Report
entry.summary:
If passed, the reported amendments would regulate bitcoin and cryptocurrency usage in the African nation. A local Nigerian newspaper has reported that Babangida Ibrahim, chairman of the House of Representatives Committee on Capital Market and Institutions of Nigeria, claimed the country will soon pass a law making the usage of bitcoin and cryptocurrencies legal. The bill would amend the 2007 Investments and Securities Act and would recognize bitcoin as legal capital for investment. Back in February of 2021, Nigeria effectively banned the usage of bitcoin with a letter prohibiting regulated financial businesses from â€œdealingâ€ with cryptocurrencies. In the same year, Bitcoin Magazine reported Nigeria soaring to the largest volume of bitcoin peer-to-peer trading in the world, and Chainanalysis reports showed that Nigeria had greatly accelerated bitcoin adoption.
The newspaper report described how Ibrahim pointed to Nigeria being behind in regards to regulation of the industry, saying â€œLike I said earlier during the second reading, we need an efficient and vibrant capital market in Nigeria. For us to do that, we have to be up to date global practices.â€ If the proposed regulation properly addresses the growing bitcoin usage within the country, it could be a major catalyst for the African continentâ€™s most populated country. Bitcoin has had a large presence in the country despite the current ban, including the construction of a Bitcoin village, Nigerian Bitcoiners participating in all sorts of development, philanthropic work from Bitcoin companies and mining being an active industry there.

entry.title: While Miners Deal With Low BTC Prices, Bitcoinâ€™s Mining Difficulty Target Expected to Increase 3% Higher
entry.summary:
Bitcoinâ€™s mining difficulty target is expected to increase on Dec. 19, 2022, after printing the largest reduction recorded in 2022 on Dec. 5, at block height 766,080. During the last 2,016 blocks, Bitcoinâ€™s hashrate has been around 254.3 exahash per second (EH/s), and block intervals have been faster at 9:41 minutes per block.
Bitcoinâ€™s Difficulty Expected to Jump 3% Higher on Dec. 19, Bitcoin Average Mining Costs Are Higher Than the Current Spot Market Value
In roughly 24 hours, the Bitcoin network will experience another difficulty transition, and this time around it is estimated to increase. The increase is estimated to be around 3.2% to 3.76% higher than the current 34.24 trillion value. The rise would lift the 34.24 trillion to around 35.53 trillion on or around Dec. 19, 2022. â€¦

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year
entry.summary: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award
entry.summary: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year
entry.summary: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's businessâ€”plus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what heâ€™s looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.
